item.title: Using Ionicons in Hugo
item.author: patrick@tryfoss.com (TryFOSS.com)
item.description: Introduction Ionicons is a great icon set created by the Ionic team. Whereas a lot of sets have pulled back from including logos, Ionicons has a large set builtin, it’s MIT licensed, and looks great on web, Android and iOS. Because it supports both SVG and web font there are a lot of ways to use Ionicons in your project. This site uses Hugo so my goal is make Ionicons available both as a partial and shortcode without Javascript.

item.title: TryFOSS.com PWA
item.author: patrick@tryfoss.com (TryFOSS.com)
item.description: Introduction We all love apps, right? They’re easy to use and at least in theory are verified and provided by a trusted source. But something about apps, in their current state, just doesn’t feel right to an open source enthusiast, does it? Sure, there’s F-Droid which is a great project and a handful of open source phones and/or phone OSes, yet, at the moment these target a pretty specialized audience.

item.title: First post!
item.author: patrick@tryfoss.com (TryFOSS.com)
item.description: Kia Ora, this is TryFOSS.com’s first post, how exciting!

item.title: About TryFOSS.com
item.author: patrick@tryfoss.com (TryFOSS.com)
item.description: TryFOSS.com is a tech blog about FOSS (free open source software) related topics. Open Source TryFOSS.com was created using the following open source software and libraries: CMS/SSG: Hugo ( https://gohugo.io ) PWA Service Worker: UpUp ( https://www.talater.com/upup ) CSS Framework: Bulma ( https://bulma.io ) JS Framework: Alpine.js ( https://alpinejs.dev ) Icon Library: Ionicons ( https://ionic.io/ionicons ) Chart Library: Chart.js ( https://www.chartjs.org )
